com.ragego.engine

Class GameNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ragego.engine.GameNode

  • public class GameNode
extends java.lang.Object
    State of the game. A node is a description of an action which can have a parent and children. The sum of parents and this node describe a state for the game. Each node has a GameBoard attached and an array of integers representing the board on this node. This representation makes easier to understand that Go Game is a sum of action which create a state. This class has useful functions to manipulates the game flow. But for analysis, you should use GameBoard.
    Since:
    1.0

      Describe actions possible in the game between two nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameNode

        public GameNode(GameBoard board,
                GameNode parent,
                GameNode.Action action,
                Intersection intersection,
                Player player)
        Create a node from a given Game board.
        Parameters:
        board - the board where we are playing
        parent - The parent node for this node (could be null)
        action - The action performed by this node (could not be null)
        intersection - Where the action is performed (could be null if action is not PUT_STONE)
        player - The player acting on this action (could be null)

      • getParent

        public GameNode getParent()
        Retrieve the parent node. If there is not one (null value), consider we are at game start point.
        Returns:
        The parent node.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(GameNode gameNode)
        Set a new parent to this node. Before setting gameNode as parent, check if this instance is a child of it. If not, add this instance as child. Normally you should call this function only one time.
        Parameters:
        gameNode - The GameNode to set as parent (should not be null)

      • addChild

        public void addChild(GameNode gameNode)
        Add a new child to this node. When you have an action to add to this state, simply add a child. After registering gameNode as child, check if this instance is his parent.
        Parameters:
        gameNode - Node to add to this one.

      • isParent

        public boolean isParent(GameNode gameNode)
        Check if a node is parent of this instance.
        Parameters:
        gameNode - The supposed parent
        Returns:
        true if it's the parent

      • hasChild

        public boolean hasChild(GameNode gameNode)
        Check if this Node has a child
        Parameters:
        gameNode - The supposed child
        Returns:
        true if it's a child of this instance.

      • getChildren

        public GameNode[] getChildren()
        Retrieve all children.
        Returns:
        An array of children of this node.

      • isMakingKO

        public boolean isMakingKO()
        Check if we are not violating the KO rule. Note if the current action is Pass, it execute this on the next parent who has not passed.
        Returns:
        true if we are violating KO rule.

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The value or null if there is not one.

      • hasParent

        public boolean hasParent()
        Check if this instance has parent.
        Returns:
        true if it's an orphan.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compare nodes to chech if they are the same. Two nodes are identical if they has the same hash code.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to compare.
        Returns:
